data.title: Young Love, First Love (1979)
data.meta_description: A teenage couple of disparate backgrounds experiences their first romance. She's a girl from a permissive California family; he's from a conservative midwestern family and has moved in with his sister on the West Coast after the death of his parents.
data.text: Valerie Bertinelli is a hip and modern (for 1979) high school senior who falls for new student Timothy Hutton when he sings "Sunshine on My Shoulders" at a choir audition. She asks him out, and they get along well, but her California ways might be a bit much for a boy who has transferred from rural Oklahoma. This meandering TV movie made when Bertinelli was at the peak of her "One Day at a Time" fame and Hutton was just about to be cast in "Ordinary People" is surprisingly entertaining, mostly due to the sheer number of melodramatic plot elements it manages to fit into an hour and a half. Bertinelli's mother (Fionnula Flanagan) is divorced and lives with herâ€¦
